events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th involving another car at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of the car collision provided by the claimant.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to assist the customer with their vehicle accident claim.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and is now in process.
The insurance company requested a police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates from the customer.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including the police report, damage photos, and repair estimates for review.
An investigation into the details of the auto accident was initiated to verify all submitted evidence and assess liability.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the claimant was not at fault and the claim is eligible for settlement.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the vehicle repairs and associated costs as per the policy limits.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department following the customer's acceptance of the settlement proposal.
The payment to cover vehicle damage repair costs was issued promptly to the claimantâ€™s designated bank account.
The insurance claim was closed successfully after payment issuance and confirmation that repairs were underway.
